name: Rumtek Monastery
description: Rumtek Monastery, also called the Dharma Chakra Centre, is a Tibetan Buddhist gompa near Gangtok, Sikkim. It is the seat in exile of the Gyalwang Karmapa, and one of the main centres of the Karma Kagyu lineage in the world. Originally built under supervision of the 9th Karmapa in the 18th century; the current building inaugurated by the 16th Karmapa in 1966. It is known for its large prayer hall, intricate murals, silk thangkas, large Golden Stupa containing relics of the 16th Karmapa, and the Karma Shri Nalanda Institute of Buddhist Studies. The architecture is inspired by the original Tsurpu Monastery in Tibet. Located ~24 km from Gangtok. Altitude approx 1500-1800 m.
